author: dan131riley
body: This PR adds SIGABRT to the list of signals for which we initiate a stack trace.  This is motivated by recent assertion failures in ROOT 6.12 builds that may be due to thread-safety issues.  Since the InitRootHandlers module itself calls abort() to handle some failure modes, the modifications are careful to reset the SIGABRT handler to SIG_DFL at the appropriate places.
title: stack trace on SIGABRT to catch assertion failures
